com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol.classpath
Class Handler

java.lang.Object
  java.net.URLStreamHandler
      com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol.classpath.Handler
Direct Known Subclasses:
Handler, Handler
public class Handler
extends java.net.URLStreamHandler

This is used to register a URL handler for url schema/protocol "classpath", to load files from classpath. This will allow html linkref to find files within the compiled code. Example: format is "classpath://" + javapackage "/" + filename URL url = new URL("classpath://com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.css/html.css"); Ex: !!! NOTE !!!: must call static method "register()" or "jwsregister" to have this URL Handler used/registered. NOTES: 3 ways to "register" URL protocol handlers: 1: System Property on the command line or as a JWS property -Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol BUG: in 1.6, this will double launch and still not work !! jws uses more then one classloader and the correct one is never set if starting a JWS app, it's best to call URLStreamHandler.jwsregister() 2: have program set system property String sp = "com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol"; System.setProperty( "java.protocol.handler.pkgs", s ); this does not work in jws (see #1) 3: URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory(...) this works, unless other code (ex: Tomcat, etc) has already called it. Note: Hub2ImageHandler has static method that calls register.

protected  java.net.URLConnection openConnection(java.net.URL u)
           
static boolean register()
          This will need to set the system property, which is the same as runtime setting: -Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol Note: for JWS, use method jwsregister instead, since jws uses a classloader that can not be accessed.

Method Detail

register

public static boolean register()
This will need to set the system property, which is the same as runtime setting: -Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.viaoa.jfc.editor.html.protocol Note: for JWS, use method jwsregister instead, since jws uses a classloader that can not be accessed.

jwsregister

public static void jwsregister()
This should be used for JWS applications. (see notes above) it is also necessary to call: System.setSecurityManager(null); // needed for setting OA URL protocol handlers
